page.title: 01GEOGRAPHY OF THE AREA
page.content: THE AREA IS BASICALLY CHALKY DOWNLAND. THE ROLLING HILLS REACH HEIGHTS OF UP TO 165m ABOVE SEA-LEVEL AND DOWN TO 79m AT DUNSTABLE CORNER. MOST OF THE LAND IS PUT OVER TO FARMING AND AGRICULTURE WITH A MIXTURE OF ARABLE AND LIVESTOCK FARMS. THERE ARE TWO BUILT UP AREAS FIRS ROAD AND MIDDLE WINTERSLOW VILLAGE,THE FORMER BEING A RECENT HOUSING DEVELOPMENT WHICH IS ABOUT 3Km FROM THE MAIN VILLAGE (TO THE WEST). THERE IS A MAIN ROAD FROM LONDON THAT CROSSES OUR AREA TOWARDS SALISBURY, THIS IS THE A30. MUCH OF THE LAND TO THE NORTH OF THE A30 IS RESTRICTED ACCESS AND IS RESERVED FOR MILITARY USE.
